source.ca497104: ## Create wheel files for the dependency packages
source.744c0d67:
# How to install YOLOX 0.2.0 in Kaggle Competition Environment

In the Kaggle competition environment, you will probably not have an internet connection.  
You can incorporate the output of this notebook with `Add data` and install YOLOX `0.2.0` by running the following command.

## 1. add output of this notebook as a dataset

search with keyword `YOLOX 0.2.0 installation package`

![image.png](attachment:79f4ef06-fb2d-428b-82bc-021b1ca00799.png)


## 2. install the dependency package

```
%cd /kaggle/input/yolox-0-2-0-installation-package/wheelhouse
!pip install pip-21.3.1-py3-none-any.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install loguru-0.5.3-py3-none-any.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install ninja-1.10.2.3-py2.py3-none-manylinux_2_5_x86_64.manylinux1_x86_64.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install onnx-1.8.1-cp37-cp37m-manylinux2010_x86_64.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install onnx_simplifier-0.3.5-py3-none-any.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install onnxruntime-1.8.0-cp37-cp37m-manylinux_2_17_x86_64.manylinux2014_x86_64.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install onnxoptimizer-0.2.6-cp37-cp37m-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install thop-0.0.31.post2005241907-py3-none-any.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install tabulate-0.8.9-py3-none-any.whl -f ./ --no-index
!pip install pycocotools-2.0.4-cp37-cp37m-linux_x86_64.whl -f ./ --no-index
```


## 3. install YOLOX 0.2.0 
```
!cp -r /kaggle/input/yolox-0-2-0-installation-package/YOLOX /kaggle/working
%cd /kaggle/working/YOLOX
!pip install --no-index -r requirements.txt
!pip install -v -e . 
```
